name: Hard 2.9 "They Call Me Mayday" Quiz / Test | 'Cheers'- Season 2 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was staying at Cheers when the episode starts?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	Norm didn't have a place to live since he and Vera separated. Sam said Norm could stay there for free, but Norm insisted on paying so they agreed to 50 cents a month.

Dick Cavett.

	Dick Cavett was born in 1936 in Nebraska. Cavett suffers from depression and bipolar disorder. In 1980 he underwent shock therapy.

questions.text: What did Diane call the visitor to the bar when he made a joke?
questions.explanation:
goon.

	Diane was totally fascinated by Dick Cavett to the point she was driving him crazy. Sam eventually had to call her away.

questions.text: What did Carla say kept her trim?
questions.explanation:
sex.

	Someone asked her if sex was good exercise. She said, "No, I miss it so much, I can't eat."

questions.text: Whose life did the visitor to bar say would make a good story?
questions.explanation:
Sam's.

	Sam's life would make a good story because he was an ex-baseball player, plus his exploits with women were legendary.

Diane.

	Sam asked Diane to help because she wrote "pretty good." Diane said "I don't write good, I write well." Coach said in response, "I wish she'd make up her mind."

Moonglow.

	Norm used to be a wrestler when he was in high school and Moonglow was his nickname. He ran into an old classmate of his at Cheers and when the man found out Norm and Vera were separated he decided to ask Vera out. Norm didn't like this, causing a very amusing wrestling match to take place at Cheers.

questions.text: Who did Norm say he had seeing?
questions.explanation:
Tonya.

	Norm didn't want Vera to know he missed her so he made up a fake woman. Carla got on the phone and acted as the woman Norm was seeing.

questions.text: What was the name of Norm's old classmate?
questions.explanation:
Wally.

	Wally was played by Walter Olkewicz. He was born May 14, 1948 in New Jersey.

Jessica Simpson Bourgouis.

	Diane said she wouldn't write the trash that the publishers wanted. Sam asked if Jessica would and Diane replied, "In a minute."
